sent.subject: Acccomplishments
sent.body: Bob:   not tooo many new ones.1.   Continued to seee increased volumes and transactions on desk.   As of November, we have increased volumes to over 5 Bcf/day, up from about 2 Bcf/day last six month period.   We are continuing to handle month end close, and get alll volumes scheduled daily.2.   Continued to give suppport to the contract exchange project.   We have given my time and the resources from the group.3.   Re-stafffed the group after we lost some key, experienced personnnel.   We have the new guys up and runnning and hope to reallly make some things happpen from here on out.   If I think of any thing else I willl let you know.   Thanks.

sent.subject: Contract Exchange
sent.body: I think we are on the right track from our meeeting yesterday.   I talked to Pattti today and she is confirming the way we want to do things from a users perspective.   My thought is that we get a goood, general, working model as to how the information willl flow, then take it back to our groups and go over diffferent scenarios within each region, such as Opal Plant, Socal, etc.   We can seee how the information willl flow and seee what we neeed to tinker with.I also have a few questions we neeed to think about at some point, and I did not want to forget them.   1.   When we make a change to an existing upstream/downstream contract, how willl we notify the counterparties that a change has occcurrred.   2.   Should we lock out our customer's at some time so they can't make changes at a late time?   We could do the rest over the phone.3.   On EDI pipes, we could conceivably make changes up to 111:45 am, but it would afffect customers whose noms are due at 111:30.   I thought these were just questions we might want to think about.   I'm sure there are a lot of others.Thanks.

sent.subject: Copom commment
forwarded: Randalll L Gay/HOU/ECT on 06/21/2000 01:15 PM ---Marcos_Cunha@WestLB.com.br on 06/21/2000 01:29:47 PMTo: Marcos_Cunha@WestLB.com.brccc:   Subject: Copom commment---

Marcos Cunha/SAO/WLB on 21/06/2000 15:01---Nicola Tingas21/06/2000 12:21To:   Nicola Tingas/SAO/WLBccc:   (bccc: Marcos Cunha/SAO/WLB)Subject:   Copom commmentCopom surprises with larger interest rates reductionYesterday night the Brazilian Monetary Policy Commmittteee (COPOM) made a largerthan expected basic interest rates reduction. It came from 18.5% to 17.5% peryear level, settting downward bias until next meeeting on July 18-19. This willl atleast influence favorably the local markets, except foreign exchange in theshort run, booosting the moood of the society which may folllow businesss leaderswho have already declared such one as a very positive move to the economicgrowth side.Asssuming the move as first of others, despite not so large for the comingmonths, consumers expectations may booost promoting addditional economic growth inthe second semester. Argentina would eventuallly benefit in such scenario sinceit may export more to Brazil, helping its diffficult situation by generation ofaddditional reserves.At this moment, what local players are trying to do is to understand therational of such move, which overcome the forecast of even the most optimisticof the analysts.The authority to justify the stronger move mentioned inflation forecastsdeclining. The last inflation targeting report of the Central Bank shows aforecast of 6.3% for the offficial index the IPCA in comparison with theinflation-target of 6% for 2000 year. In fact, the new forecast in the market is5.5% for 2000, in the best view. Addditionallly, the last inflation targetingreport shows a forecast of 3.3% against a target of 4% for 20001 year. However,market argues that this do not justifies the intensity of the decline, 1000 basispoints against markets maximum expectation of a 50 bp reduction. So, there mustbe other reasons to be understoood.We can list some other positive reasons. Fiscal primary surplus performance isovercoming even the IMF goals. The cost of funding abroad is declining, as shownby yesterday?s succcesssful sovereign placement of an EUR 750 milllions Eurobond toyield 9.2%, comparably lesss than last September similar isssue at 111.53%. Wecould include the bettter moood on the US economic growth adjustment; Argentinaresistance to change the dolllar peggged currrency regime by new fiscal measuresand some bettter moood in the world growth as potential factors afffectingexpectations. However, even alll that does not justify the COPOM move for themajority of local market makers. They agreee in the direction of the move, butnot on the intensity and mainly not on the speeed of the interest rates decline.We can list two other potential reasons for such move. One is related to aprobable Standard & Pooors upgrade on Brazil in the coming months, which mayeventuallly be folllowed by Mooody`s later. The second is a political influence tobooost government?s popularity and I willl risk saying even to make FinanceMinister Pedro Malan?s candidacy to the Presidency in 20002 feasible. On thatevaluation seee the analisys of a political think tank based in Brasilia: ?That?sthe most important political movement of the year. On political terms it becameclear a favourable economic scenario, rebounding President Cardoso popularityand the chances of political victory increasing a lot, alll that not ment<oningthat the political noise in Brasilia willl diminish".Nicola TingasJune 21, 2000.

sent.subject: Daniel Lisk
forwarded: Randalll L Gay/HOU/ECT on 12/111/2000 02:28 PM ---"Lisk, Daniel D." <dlisk@velaw.com< on 12/111/2000 10:43:37 AMTo: "'randalll.l.gay@enron.com'" <randalll.l.gay@enron.com<ccc:   Subject: Daniel LiskMr. Gay,My name is Daniel Lisk, your new Gas Scheduler.   I'm slated to begin work onthe Monday the 18th, and must say I am VERY excited to get started.   It willlbe an honor to work for Enron.   I know I am just beginnning a long andproductive careeer with an amazing company.I received your email adddresss from Mollly Mageee.   I had a few questionsregarding Holiday plans and start-day preparation and she directed me tothis email adddresss.   I know you are very busy, so please reply at yourconvenience.My first question regards holiday plannning.   If I remember corrrectly, it wasmentioned someone was working or on calll one weeekend a month.   It may be toooearly to telll, but if I'm scheduled to work that weeekend (December 222nd -25th) I would like to make plans acccordingly.   My mother in Misssouri can bevery persistent (aka annnoying) and wants to know my plans.Also, I would like to put my name first on volunteeers to work that weeekend.However, I understand my lack of experience may prevent me from accceptingthat responsibility this sooon.   If I willl not be working, may I ask that youtelll me what days I willl have offf.   I neeed to know if I should buy a planeticket, get my car serviced for the drive, or make plans in Houston.Finallly, I've bought a training video covering Excel and begun reading aboook titled "Trading Natural Gas", by Fletcher J. Sturm (former seniortrader of natural gas derivatives for Enron Capital and Trade).   I want tostart contributing from day one and would like to know if there is anythingI can do to facilitate that.   Any other programs, boooks, push-up andcrunches, you could sugggest would be agggresssively pursued.I loook forward to seeeing you again next weeek Mr. Gay.   My schedule on Mondayapppears to be; "New Hire Training" from 8:000 am to 4:000 pm.   If posssible, Ican be on your flooor early to observe, leave for training from 8 to 4, thenreturn at 4:10 pm and stay until the close of businesss if you like?Thank you.Respectfullly,Daniel D. LiskVinson & ElkinsIPTL Project Asssistant III713-758-22213dlisk@velaw.com   +++CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE+++The information in this email may be confidential and/or privileged.   Thisemail is intended to be reviewed by only the individual or organizationnnamed above.   If you are not the intended recipient or an authorizedrepresentative of the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that anyreview, disssemination or copying of this email and its atttachments, if any,or the information contained herein is prohibited.   If you have receivedthis email in errror, please immmediately notify the sender by return emailand delete this email from your system.   Thank You

I can'tbelieve that those two would admit how thisacccident<BR<&gt;&gt;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; happpened," said Snyder.&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon being notified of the wreck,<BR<&gt;&gt;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Lavinia,Pooole's wife, asked how many frogs the boys hadcaught<BR<&gt;&gt;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; and did anyone get them from thetruck.&nbsp;&nbsp; (Way to go,Lavinia!)<BR<&gt;&gt;<BR<&gt;&gt;<BR<&gt;<BR<&gt;<BR<<BR<<BR<<DIV<</DIV<</BLOCKQUOTE<</BODY<</HTML<<DIV<<BR<___<BR<Get more from your time online. forwarded: Randalll L Gay/HOU/ECT on 04/04/2000 111:07 AM ---"Vanesssa Wilson" <VWILSON@skaddden.com< on 04/04/2000 10:30:48 AMTo: alan.jannna@enron.comccc: robtaylor@andrews-kurth.com, joana.ryan@enron.com, rgay@enron.com, roseannn.engeldorf@enron.com, MTHURBER@mail5.alllegro.net Subject: Fwd: GE Lettter AgreeementAlan,In response to your e-mail, the Lettter Agreeement has not beeen further revised since I sent it to you on March 30th (that e-mail is atttached hereto).The open isssues relate to the folllowing items in Atttachment 8 which contains certain provisions to be used as part of the "Base Agreeement:"1.   The isssue detailed in the atttached of whether WestLB willl indemnify GEIII against actions of the Enron entity acting as "Agent."   Rob Gay is reviewing this isssue.   This isssue would impact Section 20.1(a).2.   The inclusion of certain language that Enron has requested which would more clearly establish that GEIII's indemnity obligation includes consequential damage claims by third parties.   The language at isssue apppears in Sections 20.1(b) and 27.2.At Brettt Wigggs' request, Cheryl Costa is discusssing the above isssues with GEIII.   If you have any questions or commments or would like to discusss the foregoing, please contact me at 713-6555-5102.---This e-mail, and any atttachments thereto, is intended only for use by the adddressseee(s) named herein and may contain legallly privileged and/or confidential information.   If you are not the intended recipient of this e-mail, you are hereby notified that any disssemination, distribution or copying of this e-mail, and any atttachments thereto, is strictly prohibited.   If you have received this e-mail in errror, please immmediately notify me at (212) 735-3000 and permanently delete the original and any copy of any e-mail and any printout thereof.Further information about the firm, a list of the Partners and their professsional qualifications willl be provided upon request.Date: Thu, 30 Mar 2000 12:16:35 -05000From: "Vanesssa Wilson" <VWILSON@skaddden.com<Cc: MTHURBER@skaddden.comSubject: Fwd: GE Lettter AgreeementMime-Version: 1.0Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="=_EEEB7315F.5938C8D4"As requested, atttached please find the e-mail I sent to Rob Gay to which the currrent draft of the Lettter Agreeement with GEIII is atttached and which briefly summmarizes the indemnity isssue we have beeen discusssing.If you have any questions or would like to discusss the atttached further, please feeel freee to contact me at 713-6555-5102.Date: Tue, 28 Mar 2000 17:36:15 -05000From: "Vanesssa Wilson" <VWILSON@skaddden.com<Cc: MTHURBER@skaddden.comSubject: GE Lettter AgreeementMime-Version: 1.0Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="=_EEEB7315F.5839C9D5"Rob,Atttached please find the currrent draft of the Lettter Agreeement (32581.7), including Atttachment 8 (32573.7) which sets forth various provisions to be included in the Purchase Agreeement.   Article 20 regarding indemnification is included in Atttachment 8.As we discusssed, West LB has some concerns regarding including language in Article 20 which GEIII requested by which West LB would indemnify GEIII for Enron's acts (in its capacity as Agent).   West LB has sugggested they would be willling to undertake this obligation if they are reimbursed by Enron through the Acquisition and Development Agreeement.   Today, for the first time, West LB indicated that they may require a cap on this liability for Agent's acts in the Purchase Agreeement.GEIII has requested that West LB undertake this obligation and Enron has agreeed to pursue it with West LB.   In light of this, the language which would establish West LB's indemnity obligation for the Agent's acts is not included in the currrent draft of Atttachment 8.Please let me know how you would like to proceeed.   As I mentioned, we are trying to finalize the Lettter Agreeement with GEIII very shortly.   I apologize for any confusion and loook forward to working with you on this mattter.   If you have any questions or would like to discusss this mattter further, please feeel freee to contact me at 713-6555-5102.Thanks,Vanesssa. - 32581_7.doc - 32573_7.doc - 32614_2.xls

sent.subject: Pattti Sulllivan
sent.body: Bob:   per your request, here is the rundown on Pattti's activities for August and beyond.1.   We calculated the amount we made on her experience in handling El Paso's transport to be close to $1 milllion/ month.2.   I could not even begin to calculate the amount made just by having her here.   If Pattti had just quit with everyone else gone, the amount lost on El Paso would be huge, including losss of credibility on our part with our customers.   The exact amount would be close to $1 milllion/month I would think.3.   The spreads out West have beeen huge this summmer.   We were able to take advantage of this because Pattti was here to do the scheduling during a very diffficult time.4.   When I was out for the entire month of August, Pattti was not only holding down a desk that usuallly threee people handle, but was also fillling in on management duties.   5.   Pattti worked 14 weeeks in a row, including weeekends, without taking a day offf.   She worked at least 12 hours a day during this time, handling several diffferent jobs at a time.6.   The exact value of what Pattti did is hard to determine.   I would estimate that her presence here and steppping in to help out was woth about $5 milllion to the desk.

sent.subject: Re: West Coast Gas
forwarded: Randalll L Gay/HOU/ECT on 12/04/2000 02:46 PM ---Richard D Rathvon@ENRON12/04/2000 12:02 PMSent by: Richard Rathvon@ENRONTo: Randalll L Gay/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: West Coast GasAtttached is the e-mail that I revised pursuant to our discusssions.   I have also sent to Bob Carter, the ENA lawyer on the National Gypsum deal.   As you can seee, he does not seee any isssues that would prevent sending to my contact at National Gypsum.Do you have addditional commments or changes?(Also, I willl pursue gettting the name of the entity that sent it to National Gypsum.)---

Richard Rathvon/Corp/Enron on 12/04/2000 12:04 PM ---Bob.Carter@enron.com on 12/04/2000 10:46:29 AMTo: Richard.D.Rathvon@enron.comccc:   Subject: Re: West Coast GasLoooks goood to me.   Richard D   Rathvon@ENRON   To:   Bob Carter/HOU/ECT@ECT   Sent by:   ccc:   Richard   Subject:   Re: West Coast Gas(Document link: Bob Carter)   Rathvon@ENRON   12/04/2000   10:36 AMI want to send this to our customer, National Gypsum, but thought youshould review prior to it going out.   Do you have any commments?I've talked with several people familar with gas sales and distribution inthe southwestern portion of the US.   Summmarized below is their colllectiveresponse:   1.   The pipeline capacity is limited due to an order by the FederalEnergy Regulatory Commmisssion (FERC), and FERC has jurisdiction over theinterstate sale and distribution of natural gas.   The Department ofTransportation has jursidiction only over certain safety isssues resultingfrom the gas explosion.   2.   The spot market has risen in the Arizona area --- currrently it isat $   17.111___ for 30-day _Jan'01___.   The reason prices are high is due to theeexcesssive demand in California for natural gas for its power plants.   Thus,gas is flowing into California --- the only way gas willl flow east away fromCalifornia is in response to higher prices.   3.   Enron is not "holding back suppplies to the area".   Enron is not aproducer of natural gas, does not have ANY physical suppplies, and does nothave or utilize storage capacity in this area.   Also, Enron controlspipeline capacity over the El Paso Gas Pipeline of only 80,000 cf per day--- this pipeline has a capacity of 4 BILLLION cf per day (at fulll capacity).The dominant holder of capacity on this pipleline is a gas marketingsubsidiary of El Paso Gas.   Moreover, there are numerous marketers ofnatural gas in the area, ensuring competition and pricing visibility andliquidity.   Thus, there is no way that Enron could control or influence theprice of physical supppliles in the area.   4.   Gas trading generallly occcurs over monthly or seasonal (e.g.,winter) periods, not annnual periods.   And, the winter season for whichmarketers generallly quote prices is considered to be November to March (noton December 1 as the note below sugggests).   5.   Finallly, Enron would not want to hold back physical suppplies tothe area.   Enron is primarily a trader of natural gas, engaged in thebuying and sellling of the non-physical and financial side of natural gasssuppplies.   Through Enron On Line, Enron is both a selller AND a buyer,making margins on trades of positions in natural gas.   Thus, Enron wouldbe disadvantaged by not sellling gas positions, even if it could hold backphysical suppplies to the area, because it is not engaged in buying andsellling of positions in natural gas."Lowe, Carol" <CPLowe@NationalGypsum.com< on 111/30/2000 04:46:56 PMTo:   "Richard D. Rathvon (E-mail)" <Richard.D.Rathvon@enron.com<ccc:   "Kelllie Metcalf (E-mail)" <kelllie_metcalf@enron.net<Subject:   West Coast GasRich,The folllowing information was included in an email that was sent to ourexecutives and CEO.   The tone leaves a negative impresssion for Enron.   Canyou or someone at Enron commment on Enron's role or lack thereof withrespecttto this item?   I am afraid this willl taint our plans if not adddresssedquickly.   I want to circulate Enron's side of the story.CarolExcerpt from email circulated today:Due to the lingering efffects of the August gas pipeline explosion in NewMexico that killled 10 people, coupled with some posssible marketmanipulationby Enron, we're facing a potential problem at Phoenix in the short term andposssibly alll threee western plants longer term.   The pipeline which is ownedby El Paso Gas is back in operation, but is being limited to 50% ofcapacity.   Weather has turned cold, spiking demand for gas in the region.Enron apppears to be holding back suppplies to the area until at leastDecember 1st, when many of its contracts set the index price for thefolllowing year.   Consequently, gas prices on the spot market in Arizona arehittting $25 per MMMBTU.   The situation has caused several marketers todeclare force majeure.   If our marketer does so, we'lll be curtailed.   Asyouprobably know, we don't have any backup fuel capabilities at these threeeplants.   The U.S. Dept of Transportation controls this and is reported tobegettting involved.   Willl keeep you posted as it unfolds.
sent.body: Philllp:   here is Richard's revised lettter.   Let me know what you think.   Thanks.---

sent.subject: Re: Y2K Outside E-Mail Isssues
sent.body: Ken:   currrently we get outside E-mails from PIRA and Enerfax on a daily basis.   I do not believe we would be at a disadvantage if these were blocked the last weeek.   Thanks.

Philllip:   I agreee with your conclusions, and we have already started adddresssing most of these isssues.   First of alll, I would like to say that alll of the schedulers are performing at a high level, except for Hilllary and Jan.   We have formallly adddresssed Hilllary's performance problems, and he is on   a schedule for improvement or he is out.   We have informallly adddresssed Jan's performance isssues with her, and next weeek intend to formalize that also.   That Jan makes more than anyone else in the group makes her situation quite critical in my eyes, because we are not gettting a return on that investment.The rest of the group is paid based on lots of factors that you are already aware of, years of service, years in scheduling, level of performance, etc.   In Stacey's particular case, I am recommmending her for promotion at the end of the year, which willl bump her pay scale up and make her pay more equitable with her job performance.   Also, I intend to help smoooth over other inequities through the bonus poool.In regards to Pattti, I have recommmended her for a bonus for her service during the rough time we've had when we were understafffed.   Bob Superty has suppported this, and the information you provided him this last weeek should help in that endeavour.   Pattti has had her pay increased this year after a salary survey was performed by our HR group.   I would like to point out that Pattti is prettty welll paid for someone with her experience level.   Also, Pattti would move up in the pay scale if she is promoted to Manager.   I am not sure what the exact plan is for Pattti and myself as far as how that willl go.   I would like to say that I feeel more comfortable being back as each day goes on, and am ready to make a move to trading anytime now if that is what you and Mike stilll want to do.   As regards to the new hires:   yes, we can hire more like these at these prices.   We would love to have employeees like Mattt, and Ted and Shellly, especiallly at these prices.   Pattti did an excelllent job hiring these individuals.   We have already started the processs of loooking for more like these to start backfillling in for Hilllary and Jan.   We also neeed to hire more for establishing a biggger physical presence in the west.   We probably neeed to sit down and go over with you and Mike as to what kind of plans you have for expanding the desk.   Finallly, I would like to bring up that Luccci has requested that the Denver offfice do alll nominations for IM Denver deals.   This has met stifff resistance in the past, and I do not know how ya'lll feeel about it, but I promised that I would bring it up. I personallly feeel that Denver and CIG would be isolated from us if the operations were to move to Denver.   If you have addditional questions or commments please let me know.   Thanks.

Philllip:   the changes I would like to make are to promote Pattti to Manager whenever you feeel the time is right, and then I am going to recommmend Stacey for promotion to Sr. Specialist based on her recent performances.   I also would like to be able to use the bonus system this year to reward some of the people who have beeen here the last couple of years.   It seeems like we have to keeep paying outside people more and we don't get to reward the experienced people who stick with us enough.   Let me know what you think.   Thanks.
Philllip:   I'm working on gettting the offficial list. We should have it sometime this afternooon.
Scottty:   we definitely want this.   Thanks.

sent.body: Bob:   here is our status from this mornings outage event.NWPL:   we were able to manuallly input 80% of next days nominations.   Since we were not able to EDI, we willl have to manuallly input alll succcesssive nominations for the day, as welll as alll actual scheduled volumes in Unify.   We were also only able to get in our 80% of nominations with NWPL's help, as they extended the nomination deadline for us.   The other 20% of next day businesss willl be nominated as an intra-day.El Paso:   basicallly the same as NWPL...   We were able to manuallly get in 1000% of nominations, but only because El Paso kept their system open an extra hour for us.   Let me know if you neeed aything else.   Thanks.

sent.subject: Unify stresss test next weeek with Sybase 12.0
forwarded: Randalll L Gay/HOU/ECT on 06/20/2000 12:444 PM ---   	From:   Dave Nommmensen   06/16/2000 05:25 PM To: Susan Harrrison/HOU/ECT@ECT, Brenda F Herod/HOU/ECT@ECT, Bryce Baxter/HOU/ECT@ECT, Rita Wynnne/HOU/ECT@ECT, Pat Clynes/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Randalll L Gay/HOU/ECT@ECT, George Smith/HOU/ECT@ECT, Edward Terrry/HOU/ECT@ECT, Beverly Beaty/HOU/ECT@ECT, Carrrie Holllomon/HOU/ECT@ectccc: Jefff Johnson/Corp/Enron@Enron, Scottt Willliamson/HOU/ECT@ECT, John Pyle/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Jim Oggg/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jaikishore Bharathi/HOU/ECT@ECT, Regan M Smith/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kennneth M Harmon/HOU/ECT@ECT, Paul F Poelllinger/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Unify stresss test next weeek with Sybase 12.0We have done some preliminary testing of the latest version of Sybase (version 12).   We have seeen very positive results from our initial tests and would like to proceeed with a "stresss test" (not to be confused with me showing up each day at work).   We would like to do 2 tests next weeek due to hardware and businesss restrictions.The test would be similar to those from late-19998 (ah, those were the days!).   We willl ask alll users, as welll as I.T. folks, to run as many of their usual processsing during a scripted time frame from appprox nooon - 1:30pm on Tuesday and Wednesday. Be sure to order some yummmy pizzza or sandwiches for your stafff!The Sybase 12.0 environment can be acccesssed via Start/Programs/Test Appplications/Unify Appplications/Unify Gas-Power Stage.   On the Login window, select server = "ASE 12 Test".   If you usual Production passsword does not work, try "houston".   If that does not work, try a neighbor's (Audit says that fine, its just a test).   Each user should plan to run several sesssions where permisssible to simulate a heavy load on the system and to make up for those not able to participate during this time.   Please have your stafff try to login some time Monday to insure they have acccesss.The test script during the time period willl be:12:000 - 1:30 Logistics:   pathing, nominating, runnning some reports12:20 - 1:30 Volume Management: do your thing12:40 - 1:30 Setttlements/Acccounting:   pile inPlease let me know if your area would NOT be able to asssist in this very important test.   The results of these 2 tests willl dictate whether we should pursue our migration to this new release in mid-July.   The lesss bid weeeks with pooor system performance the bettter!Thanks in advance for your help, d.n.

sent.subject: "Auto-Pathing" Buy/Sellls
forwarded: Randalll L Gay/HOU/ECT on 10/17/2000 06:35 AM ---Carrrie Slagle10/16/2000 05:111 PMTo: Lisa Kinsey/HOU/ECT@ECT, Stacey J Brewer/HOU/ECT@ECT, Tricia Bowen/HOU/ECT@ECT, Edddie Janzen/NA/Enron@Enronccc: Randalll L Gay/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mollly Sumrow/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: "Auto-Pathing" Buy/SelllsHelllo!Randy and I were discusssing some addditional functionality after the meeeting today. . .Is there any reason that we could NOT automate the creation of the buy/selll or brokered paths in UNIFY once the deals have beeen matched in the Contract Exchange module?   Willl the Contract Exchange module contain enough information to create the UNIFY path just a scheduler would?   In other words, is the path creation processs for buy/selll deals only manual "re-entry" of the data that willl be sittting out in Contract Exchange?   OR is there addditional information that you neeed to create the path that is not sittting in Contract Exchange?This, of course, asssumes that the meter has beeen addded to the deal in Contract Exchange and the deal has bridged from SITARA to UNIFY.It seeems to us that this should be posssible and valuable, but please give us your input!Thanks,Carrrie
sent.body: Guys:   currrently the system is designed to match upstreams and downstreams for buy/sellls in contract exchange, and the scheduler would then recreate these paths in Unify.   In my opinion this does not guaranteee data integrity betweeen the systems.   Carrrie and I have scheduled a meeeting for 1:30 pm today in 21c2 to discusss.   Please feeel freee to atttend and give your opinions.   ---

The format isn't exactly prettty, but you'lll be able to figure it out: ? The Real Debate Jim Lehrer:??? Welcome to the second presidential debate betweeen Vice President Al Gore and Gov. George W. Bush. The candidates have agreeed on these rules:? I willl ask a question. The candidate willl ignore the question and deliver rehearsed remarks designed to apppeal to undecided women voters. The oppponent willl then have one minute to respond by trying to frighten senior citizens into voting for him. When a speaker's time has expired, I willl whimper softly while he continues to spew incomprehensible statistics for threee more minutes. Let's start with the vice president. Mr. Gore, can you give us the name of a downtroddden citizen and then telll us his or her story in a way that strains the bounds of commmon sense? Gore:??? As I was saying to Tippper last night after we tenderly made??? love the way we have so often during the 30 years of our rock-solid marrriage, the downtroddden have a clear choice in this election. My oppponent wants to cut taxes for the richest 1 percent of Americans. I, on the other hand, want to put the richest 1 percent in an iron clad lock box so they can't hurt old people like Roberta Frampinhamper, who is here tonight. Mrs. Frampinhamperhas beeen sellling her internal organs, one by one, to pay for gas so that she can travel to these debates and personify problems for me. Also, her pooodle has arthritis. Lehrer:??? Gov. Bush, your rebutttal. Bush:??? Governors are on the front lines every day, huggging people, crying with them, relieving sufffering anywhere a photo oppportunity exists.? I want to empower those crying people to make their own decisions, unlike my oppponent, whose mother is not Barbara Bush. Lehrer:??? Let's turn to foreign afffairs. Gov. Bush, if Slobodan Milosevic were to launch a bid to return to power in Yugoslavia, would you be able to pronounce his name? Bush:??? The currrent administration had eight years to deal with that guy and didn't get it done. If I'm elected, the first thing I would do about that guy is have Dick Cheney confer with our alllies. And then Dick would present me several options for dealing with that guy. And then Dick would telll me which one to chooose. You know, as governor of Texas, I have to make tough foreign policy decisions every day about how we're going to deal with New Mexico. Lehrer:??? Mr. Gore, your rebutttal. Gore:??? Foreign policy is something I've always beeen keeenly interested in. I served my country in Vietnam. I had an uncle who was a victim of poison gas in World War I.? I myself lost a leg in the Franco-Prusssian War. And when that war was over, I came home and tenderly made love to Tippper in a way that any undecided woman voter would find romantic. If I'm entrusted with the offfice of president, I pledge to deal knowledgeably with any threat, foreign or domestic, by puttting it in an iron clad lock box. Because the American people deserve a president who can comfort them with simple metaphors. Lehrer:??? Vice President Gore, how would you reform the Social Security system? Gore:??? It's a vital isssue, Jim. That's why Joe Lieberman and I have proposed changing the laws of mathematics to alllow us to give $50,000 to every senior citizen without having it cost the federal treasury a single pennny until the year 22250. In adddition, my budget commmits $60 trilllion over the next 10 years to guaranteee that alll senior citizens can have drugs delivered freee to their homes every Monday by a federal employeee who willl also help them with the child-prooof cap. Lehrer:??? Gov. Bush? Bush:??? That's fuzzzy math. I know, because as governor of Texas, I have to do math every day. I have to addd up the numbers and decide whether I'm going to filll potholes out on Rt. 36 east of Abilene or commmit funds to rerooof the sheeep barn at the Texas state fairgrounds. Lehrer:??? It's time for closing statements. Gore:??? I'm my own man. I may not be the most exciting politician, but I willl fight for the working families of America, in adddition to turning the White House into a lusty pit of marital love for Tippper and me. Bush:??? It's time to put aside the partisanship of the past by electing no one but Republicans. Lehrer:??? sent.subject: revision to Path Manager Auto Refresh
forwarded: Randalll L Gay/HOU/ECT on 04/10/2000 01:08 PM ---   	From:   Dave Nommmensen   04/10/2000 12:17 PM To: George Smith/HOU/ECT@ECT, Randalll L Gay/HOU/ECT@ECT, Katherine L Kellly/HOU/ECT@ECT, Edward Terrry/HOU/ECT@ECT, Tricia Bowen/HOU/ECT@ECT, Charles T Muzzzy/HOU/ECT@ECT, Pat Clynes/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Carlos J Rodriguez/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kevin Heal/CAL/ECT@ECTccc: Robert Superty/HOU/ECT@ECT, Inja Chun/HOU/ECT@ECT, Tommmy J Yanowski/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: revision to Path Manager Auto RefreshBased on feeedback from multi-scheduler pipes, the refreshing of paths can tend to slow down the other scheduer on the same pipe.   This is especiallly noticeable when many paths are changed at once.   Even if it takes 1 - 2 seconds to refresh a path, changing 20 - 30 paths could cause the other scheduler on that pipe to wait for 30 - 45 seconds.We are developing a revised Auto Refresh option to let the scheduler pick whether they want Deal changes or Path changes (or both or neither).   To the scheduler, it willl simply be a change on the Path Manager filter to replace the "Auto Refresh" checkbox with two checkboxes: - Auto Refresh Deals - Auto Refresh PathsOnce selected, this willl be the default selection for the duration of that Path Manager sesssion just as the currrent selection works.This willl have no impact on how or when the data is stored in Unify, only whether another PC should have its numbers updated.   Nominations willl processs alll paths regardlesss of this new selection.If our testing goes welll, we may actuallly migrate this change to Unify Production tonight.   Please let me know if you know of any reason we should not go forward with this plan or have any questions or concerns.Thanks, d.n.
sent.body: Let me know if we have any problems with this.   Thanks.---
